person_say: I always underestimate the time to complete tasks. How can I estimate better?
animal_say: Buzz! To improve your time estimation, try breaking your tasks into smaller chunks and estimate the time needed for each part. Use a timer to track how long things really take, and practice adding a buffer time to your estimates! How does that sound, buzz?

person_say: That sounds like a good idea! Breaking tasks into smaller chunks could really help, and using a timer might make me more aware of how long things actually take. I'm definitely going to try adding some buffer time too!
animal_say: Buzz buzz! I'm thrilled to hear you're excited about trying those tips. Remember, every small step brings you closer to your goals! If you have more time management needs or any excuses for procrastination, I'm here to help!

person_say: Thanks for the encouragement! I'll definitely keep those tips in mind. I appreciate your help!
animal_say: Buzz! I'm so glad to be of help! Remember, every little bit of progress counts. If you ever need to tackle procrastination or anything else, I'm here to support you!
